content.title: Mission Solar Charkha
content.department: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
content.beneficiary: Spinners, Weavers, Stitches, and other skilled artisans
content.details: The scheme 'Mission Solar Charkha' is a pilot project implemented by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India. It envisages setting up of Solar Charkha Clusters which would mean a focal village and other surrounding villages in a radius of 8 to 10 Kilometres. Each cluster will have 200 to 2042 beneficiaries. The Government of India has approved the setup of 50 such clusters with a budget of 550 Crores for 2018-19 and 2019-20, aiming to generate direct employment of nearly one lakh persons.
eligibility: Existing Khadi and Village Industry Institution (KVI) with a positive balance sheet and assets.
KVI having an artisan base of not less than 200.
KVI having a sales turnover of not less than ₹1.00 Crore in each of the preceding three financial years.
Other Institutions such as SPV, Society, Trust, Section 8 Company or LLP under the Companies Act, 2013.
First Timers with a commitment to social and rural upliftment.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Applicants may visit the Official Website of Mission Solar Charkha to apply online.
documents_required: Legal Status of the organization (certificate of registration)
Establishment date & summary of registered Objectives
List of Governing Body / Board of Directors
List of organizations with which formal MoU's / linkages exist
Date of last Annual General Meeting (attach the minutes of the meeting)
Annual Audited statement & IT returns for the last 3 years
CV/bio-data of a person with domain expertise
Details of any other notable activities in innovation and entrepreneurship
Details on the institution's strength and preparedness in hosting Cluster
Year-wise work plan for three years

faqs.question: What is the 'Mission Solar Charkha'?
faqs.answer: The 'Mission Solar Charkha' envisages setting up of Solar Charkha Clusters which would mean a focal village and other surrounding villages in a radius of 8 to 10 Kilometres.

faqs.question: Which ministry has launched 'Mission Solar Charkha (MSC)'?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSME), Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To ensure inclusive growth by generating employment, especially for women and youth, and sustainable development through solar charkha clusters in rural areas.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy involved for one cluster of Solar Charkha?
faqs.answer: One cluster of Solar Charkha would involve a maximum subsidy of ₹9.599 cr.

faqs.question: Who can apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals, Existing Khadi & Village Industry Institutions, and other Institutions such as SPV, Society, Trust, Section 8 Company or LLP under Companies Act, 2013.
